t: Psalm 31
Into Your Hand I Commit My Spirit
To the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.
In*pn you, O Lord,*s do I take refuge; let*ld me never be put to shame; in*ld your righteousness deliver me!
Incline*ln your ear to me; rescue*ld me speedily! Be*ln a rock of refuge for me, a*ld strong fortress to save me!
For*pn you are my rock and my fortress; and*ld for your name’s sake you lead me and guide me;
you*ln take me out of the net they have hidden for me, for*ld you are my refuge.
Into*ln your hand I commit my spirit; you*ld have redeemed me, O Lord,*s faithful God.
I*pn hate those who pay regard to worthless idols, but*ld I trust in the Lord.*s
I*ln will rejoice and be glad in your steadfast love, because*ld you have seen my affliction; you*ld have known the distress of my soul,
and*ln you have not delivered me into the hand of the enemy; you*ld have set my feet in a broad place.
Be*pn gracious to me, O Lord,*s for I am in distress; my*ld eye is wasted from grief; my*ld soul and my body also.
For*ln my life is spent with sorrow, and*ld my years with sighing; my*ln strength fails because of my iniquity, and*ld my bones waste away.
Because*pn of all my adversaries I have become a reproach, especially*ld to my neighbors, and*ln an object of dread to my acquaintances; those*ld who see me in the street flee from me.
I*ln have been forgotten like one who is dead; I*ld have become like a broken vessel.
For*ln I hear the whispering of many— terror*ld on every side!— as*ln they scheme together against me, as*ld they plot to take my life.
But*pn I trust in you, O Lord;*s I*ld say, “You are my God.”
My*ln times are in your hand; rescue*ld me from the hand of my enemies and from my persecutors!
Make*ln your face shine on your servant; save*ld me in your steadfast love!
O*ln Lord,*s let me not be put to shame, for*ld I call upon you; let*ln the wicked be put to shame; let*ld them go silently to Sheol.
Let*ln the lying lips be mute, which*ld speak insolently against the righteous in*ld pride and contempt.
Oh,*pn how abundant is your goodness, which*ld you have stored up for those who fear you and*ln worked for those who take refuge in you, in*ld the sight of the children of mankind!
In*ln the cover of your presence you hide them from*ld the plots of men; you*ln store them in your shelter from*ld the strife of tongues.
Blessed*pn be the Lord,*s for*ld he has wondrously shown his steadfast love to me when*ld I was in a besieged city.
I*ln had said in my alarm, “I*ld am cut off from your sight.” But*ln you heard the voice of my pleas for mercy when*ld I cried to you for help.
Love*pn the Lord,*s all you his saints! The*ld Lord*s preserves the faithful but*ld abundantly repays the one who acts in pride.
Be*ln strong, and let your heart take courage, all*ld you who wait for the Lord!*s
